instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Dead
threads.message:
Hi all,

History of this board is liquid i believe but someone has cleaned and messed with <CHIP>U7200</CHIP>.

Anyway it's dead - when connected to PSU it draws 1.4 amps and then straight back down to 0.02.

All the rails are present when it's first connected and sometimes it stays on and cpu/gpu get hot but then it powers off again.

<CHIP>U7200</CHIP> i have now replaced along with <CAPACITOR>C7202</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7202</RESISTOR> as they were fucked with.

PPBUS = 12.6v
pp3v42 = 3.42v

Currently it is in S5 obviously but S4 is working but only for the split second it powers up.

With no other hints i am lost, any ideas?

Update: When shorting pads (<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>) it powers on and then off again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Dead
threads.message: Could be absolutely anything. Checked all rails for shorts? CPU Vcore coming on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Dead
threads.message: Yes CPU Vcore was present when it was on - it stayed on for a while last time. No output externally either. Sending this back I think... thanks anyway!
